channel.title: Hiding rank title
channel.description:
So, out of curiosity, would it be at all possible to completely hide the rank title under the current alias in threads? No pressure, just idle curiosity (or maybe even a blank usergroup?).
Also, I've got a spare key of this if anyone is interested: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Humble_Indie_Bundle#Humble_Frozenbyte_Bundle

item.title: Hiding rank title
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:18, topic:417712”]Nah. I never really liked the idea of linking something like that (or rep, for that matter) to a rank. Display the ‘Thanks’ on the profile where rep is, rank would be unrelated.

Though, perhaps it’d be better named something similar to Facebook’s Like button, or Google’s +1. Because much of the talk over on mitb.com is just general discussion, not really much to thank, other than the bit of activity in the RS2 dev sections.[/quote]
just what mitb needs, socialising!

Read full topic

item.title: Hiding rank title
item.dc:creator: @eXemplar eXemplar
item.description:
@eXemplar wrote:

Yeah, that’s pretty much it mitb. Maybe a profile option to “hide rank from posts”, but if it’s something you have to hack in I wouldn’t worry too much about it.

Read full topic

item.description:

I would love that key if it is still available.

Also, I second this. People should have complete control over what is shown in the sidebar.

item.title: Hiding rank title
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:10, topic:417712”]To make the CM-rank more worth, rise the rep requirement and/or set some other requirements like approvals from CM/GM/Admins.

Newty: Time of being here doesn’t mean anything. The argument or idea should stand on its own merits, not the person who made it.

But as pointed out in this thread, why give a shit about ranks? The only ones that matters is Mod/GMod/Admin[/quote]
No need, CM or no CM people don’t actually do anything RS related on these boards. We don’t even see the “my epenis (updater) is better than yours” threads anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: Hiding rank title
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Except this rank is based on the abused thing!

I think it should just be removed entirely or the requirement readjusted, having a rank based on reputation is not a good idea (at least on this forum).

EDIT - When I say removed I meant completely rethought out, sorry for any confusion.

Read full topic

item.title: Hiding rank title
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I was actually just going to make a thread recommending that Community Member go the way of MoparScape Vet, ie, turn it into a hidden rank. (Just like eXemplar has, he shows up as Senior Member, but is also a Community Member) Would anyone be opposed to that, and why?

I am against this because even though Community Member is absolutly useless I want the ability to shove it into peoples faces. Bragging rights, thats all.

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:2, topic:417712”]how would you want it implemented?

  1. A setting for you to turn it off for your account for everyone (no one sees your group or stars).
  2. A setting for you to not see any accounts group or stars? (people choose for themselves to either see all groups/stars, or to not see any groups/stars)[/quote]
    It would be nice if we could have both options. That way I can hide myself from people that haven’t hidden everyones group/stars AND turn everyones group/stars off for myself.

Read full topic

item.title: Hiding rank title
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I was actually just going to make a thread recommending that Community Member go the way of MoparScape Vet, ie, turn it into a hidden rank. (Just like eXemplar has, he shows up as Senior Member, but is also a Community Member) Would anyone be opposed to that, and why?

As to what eXemplar wants, you mean instead of:

eXemplar
Senior Member
****
Rep: 200
[Rep++] [Rep–]

to:

eXemplar
Rep: 200
[Rep++] [Rep–]

and how would you want it implemented?

  1. A setting for you to turn it off for your account for everyone (no one sees your group or stars).
  2. A setting for you to not see any accounts group or stars? (people choose for themselves to either see all groups/stars, or to not see any groups/stars)

SMF certainly doesn’t support it by default, but it doesn’t mean it can’t be done.

Read full topic
